title: Corrie's Kym Marsh is nervous about waving army boyfriend off as he heads to Middle East
text:
She’s always worried about his safety (Picture: @marsh_kym/Instagram)

Kym Marsh is a nervous wreck about waving off her army boyfriend Scott Ratcliffe as he heads on tour in the Middle East.

The Coronation Street actress revealed that she’s filled with ‘anxiety’ every time Scott, 42, doesn’t answer calls and messages.

‘There is always anxiety, it is always stressful when he goes away,’ she said to The Sun.

‘There may not be an actual war threat currently but there’s always a risk when you’re in these dangerous places.

‘And it can be extra worrying when you aren’t able to communicate for periods of time.’

If your boyfriend is a major in the Parachute Regiment, you’d be worried too.

She continued: ‘And it can be extra worrying when you aren’t able to communicate for periods of time.

‘If he’s on a base he can get in touch, but there are times when he is out on exercises and I don’t hear from him for three weeks because there is just no signal…

‘He always says that it’s the families at home who are the brave ones — they just don’t see themselves as brave at all. But it won’t be easy watching him go away, and I will worry until I see him again.’

Scott is sometimes based in South England (Picture: Jeff Spicer/Getty Images)

The 43-year-old is saying goodbye to her Coronation Street role as Michelle Connor at the same time as waving goodbye to her boyfriend.

After 13 years on the long-running soap, she has decided to spend more time with her boyfriend as he’s often on his base in the south of England.

Kym – who joined the cast in the West End production of Elf: A Christmas Spectacular – met Scott last year after her co-star Antony Cotton set them up.

On leaving Corrie, the mum-of-four said: ‘A bonus of leaving Coronation Street might be that I get to spend more time enjoying the other things in my life — the filming schedules can be very fast paced and you spend a lot of time there — but I’m not planning on slowing down, there are loads of new things that I want to do.

‘Life can be a bit manic. When you factor in having a grandchild and an eight-year-old daughter I am like the old woman who lived in the shoe. It’s a bit like living in Mothercare at the moment.

‘Scott lives on a base which is down south, but we make it work as it is for now. We’re happy with the balance we have and it works.’
